title: Presidential Nominations Sent to the Senate, 12/2/09 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
December 02, 2009

 



Presidential Nominations Sent to the Senate, 12/2/09





	Michael A. Khouri, of Kentucky, to be a Federal Maritime Commissioner for a term expiring June 30, 2011, vice Steven Robert Blust, resigned.

	David W. Mills, of Virginia, to be an Assistant Secretary of Commerce, vice Darryl W. Jackson, resigned.

	Douglas A. Rediker, of Massachusetts, to be United States Alternate Executive Director of the International Monetary Fund for a term of two years, vice Daniel D. Heath, term expired.
